item.title: Yanks announce ticket info; new plans on tap
item.description: Yanks announce ticket info; new plans on tap
item.content:encoded: The Yankees have announced general ticket information for regular-season games played at Yankee Stadium, stating that more than 70 percent of prices will be reduced or unchanged.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Grandy, Cano place behind MVP Verlander
item.description: Grandy, Cano place behind Verlander
item.content:encoded: Neither Curtis Granderson nor Robinson Cano was crowned as the winner of the American League Most Valuable Player Award, which went to Tigers ace Justin Verlander in the results of the voting by the Baseball Writers' Association of America, announced on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Yankees add five players to 40-man roster
item.description: Yankees add five players to 40-man roster
item.content:encoded: The Yankees added five players to their 40-man roster prior to Friday's deadline, thereby protecting them from next month's Rule 5 Draft.
item.dc:creator: Anthony DiComo

item.title: Cashman camps outdoors to benefit homeless
item.description: Cashman camps outdoors to benefit homeless
item.content:encoded: Brian Cashman nearly never met Kevin Ryan. And if that were the case, Cashman wouldn't have been sleeping on the street in New York on Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: Joey Nowak

item.title: Steinbrenner 'concerned' about Yanks' rotation
item.description: Steinbrenner 'concerned' about Yanks' rotation
item.content:encoded: Hal Steinbrenner's sense of the Yankees is no different than the popular perception.
item.dc:creator: Anthony DiComo

item.title: Girardi fifth in AL Manager of Year Award voting
item.description: Girardi fifth in AL Manager of Year Award voting
item.content:encoded: Pushing the buttons from the manager's seat in the Bronx is never mistaken for a low-stress task, but many observers agreed that Yankees skipper Joe Girardi met many of his tasks with aplomb over the course of the 2011 season.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Many vying for few in free-agent arms race
item.description: Many vying for few in free-agent arms race
item.content:encoded: Starting pitching is scarce this winter. That is no secret. With scant few starters available on the free-agent market, many teams have already displayed overlapping interest in the few quality arms available.
item.dc:creator: Anthony DiComo

item.title: Gardner returns to Bronx to help out schools
item.description: Gardner returns to Bronx to help out schools
item.content:encoded: Brett Gardner was back up from his small hometown in South Carolina for the day, and he was immersed in a book that he was reading to wide-eyed children in the Bronx.
item.dc:creator: Mark Newman

item.title: Sabathia fourth in AL Cy Young Award voting
item.description: Sabathia fourth in AL Cy Young Award voting
item.content:encoded: The importance of CC Sabathia's presence in a rotation cannot be understated, to the point where the Yankees' main focus immediately after the season was to make sure their left-handed ace wasn't going anywhere.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Nova recognized, but falls short of '11 ROY
item.description: Nova recognized, but falls short of '11 ROY
item.content:encoded: Ivan Nova went 16-4 with a 3.70 ERA for the Yankees to earn consideration for the American League Rookie of the Year Award, which ultimately went to Tampa Bay's Jeremy Hellickson.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Three execs lead lively chat for fundraiser
item.description: Three execs lead lively chat for fundraiser
item.content:encoded: Three Major League executives converged on a small town in Vermont on Saturday night, including the one who just gave up New England in favor of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Evan Drellich

item.title: Rutgers wins Yankee Stadium clash with Army
item.description: Rutgers wins Yankee Stadium clash with Army
item.content:encoded: Army's football team renewed its historic connection to Yankee Stadium on Saturday, when it played host to Rutgers at its home away from West Point. The Black Knights, winless away from Michie Stadium, took an early lead but eventually absorbed a 27-12 loss.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Fordin

item.title: Yankees campers get to face ex-big leaguers
item.description: Yankees campers get to face ex-big leaguers
item.content:encoded: It may not be the real thing, but for 67 campers this week in Tampa, Fla., Yankees Fantasy Camp sure seemed close enough.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Yanks campers pause to honor veterans
item.description: Yanks campers pause to honor veterans
item.content:encoded: The morning at Steinbrenner Field started with a ceremony, as the assembled Fantasy Campers lined the infield in acknowledgement of Veterans Day.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Yankees honor veterans with community project
item.description: Yankees honor veterans with community project
item.content:encoded: A brisk chill swept through the Great Hall at Yankee Stadium on Friday morning, but that, along with the early-morning wakeup call, didn't deter a number of Yankees front-office staffers and volunteers who gathered for a Veterans Day volunteer effort in the Bronx.
item.dc:creator: Joey Nowak

item.title: Torre's Safe At Home gala back for ninth year
item.description: Torre's Safe At Home gala back for ninth year
item.content:encoded: Joe Torre enlisted some old friends and familiar faces to help with a cause near to his heart Thursday, when his Safe At Home Foundation held its ninth annual gala at Pier Sixty of Chelsea Piers.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Fordin

item.title: Yankees to play Mets twice during spring
item.description: Yankees to play Mets twice during spring
item.content:encoded: The Yankees will play a pair of Spring Training exhibitions against the Mets for the first time since 1996, highlighting the club's Grapefruit League schedule released on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Wear and tear sets in for Yanks campers
item.description: Wear and tear sets in for Yanks campers
item.content:encoded: The Yankees are holding the first of their two offseason Fantasy Camps this week at their Spring Training complex in Tampa, Fla. Bryan Hoch, who covers the Yankees for MLB.com, is taking part and will be writing a daily diary of his experiences.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Posada believes he won't be back with Yanks
item.description: Posada believes he won't be back with Yanks
item.content:encoded: Jorge Posada said that his days as a Yankees player are over and that he must decide between joining another team or retiring after 17 Major League seasons.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch

item.title: Fantasy campers learn about repercussions
item.description: Fantasy campers learn about repercussions
item.content:encoded: One lesson we all learned today is that there are repercussions for your actions, even at the Fantasy Camp level.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Hoch
